intro: Hieracium meizocephalum, commonly known as the large-headed hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its robust growth habit and distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are upright and often branched. Hieracium meizocephalum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
